title: How to trick a YouTube copyright strikes (e.g., uploading some copyrighted music video without getting caught) - Quora

response.answer_text: there’s a few ways to do it but, as you surely understand, I won’t give details on them. mirroring the images vertically so the left is at the right and viceversa can work, using only short parts of what you want to show to break continuity can work, using a frame and channing the position of the real content can also work. none of them is fully satisfactory for those viewing the content though and you can still be caught. if not now, when the algorithm improves. (it does daily) but… above everything else… do you think anybody here will truly give you his magical formula to fool youtube? not happening. if somebody from youtube reads this then the method will become worthless in less than a week. this is the kind of thing you can only ask in private.

Would you like any advice on shoplifting too? YouTube’s detection equipment is very sophisticated - suggestions about making minor changes are nonsense - even if they weren’t there’s nothing to stop the copyright holder finding it or being informed of it. I used an image belonging to someone else (no way of finding the copyright holder) I did ask if the copyright holder would contact me if he found out, about six months later he contacted me, said how much he liked my video and even offered me more images. So it proves it isn’t always up to automatic image or audio detectors to find copyright infringements.
Edit video with some little changes, And add some disturbance in audio and then upload . If you do like this you don't get any strikes.
